name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

strengths: Toxic Gas shuts down ALL Pokemon Powers in play
Devastates decks relying on abilities (Rain Dance, Damage Swap)
Sludge can Poison for extra damage over time
weaknesses: Only 70 HP is fragile for such an important piece
Sludge is weak at 30 damage for 3 energy
synergies: Decks that don't rely on Pokemon Powers
counters: Status conditions to disable Toxic Gas
Gust of Wind to force Muk active and KO it
Decks that don't rely on Pokemon Powers

competitiveHistory: This non-holo version of Muk is functionally identical to the holo version (#13). Muk was format-defining with its Toxic Gas ability shutting down all Pokemon Powers. The non-holo printing made this essential tech card accessible to all competitive players, which was crucial given its metagame importance.

rulings.ruling: Toxic Gas affects all Pokemon Powers in play, including your own and your opponent's.
Multiple Muks in play don't stack - one Toxic Gas is enough to disable all powers.
If Muk becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, all Pokemon Powers immediately resume working.
Toxic Gas does not prevent Pokemon Powers from existing, only from being used or having any effect.
Powers that were already in effect (like attached effects) are not removed, but new activations are prevented.
